quoteFirst: On this day the sun reaches his northern limit, 23° 27′ 3.2″, and at 2:42 a. m. begins his southern journey; or, to put it astronomically, the sun enters _Gemini_, and summer begins, on June 21st, at 1:42 a. m. On the 1st, sun rises at
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, June 1885, No. 9
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
